channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - thesixthaxis_com
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 08/11/25
item.content:encoded:
The travails of Grand Theft Auto 6 really are a sign of just how much game development has changed over the decades. There were three GTAs on PS2, there were two on PS3, and now we’re lucky to see one big game a generation from Rockstar – I think we ought to really count Red Dead Redemption 2 in this. It’s something that’s echoed by the likes of Naughty Dog, where the most prestigious studios now take what feels like forever to produce their games.

Anyway, I’m talking about that because GTA 6 got delayed by another six months.

In the News This Week

So, that’s obviously the biggest headline of the week, closely followed by the back and forth over work unionisation at Rockstar. Let’s get to those and all the other biggest stories we’ve caught.

  • GTA 6 has been delayed again to November 2026
  • Rockstar responds to union busting accusations, says fired employees were leakers
  • Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra has now been delayed beyond early 2026
  • Square Enix announces staff redundancies alongside increased use of AI
  • Dead By Daylight 2v8 mode is getting a Silent Hill x Castlevania crossover
  • Steam Deck can now download on the down low with new display-off mode
  • PlayStation Portal gets full PS Plus cloud streaming, and you can even stream your own games
  • ’83 Early Access has been pushed back to 2026
  • The Fortnite X Simpsons crossover has been a pretty big hit
  • Battlefield 6’s challenges just got a lot easier to do
  • The end of Halo Infinite content is here with Operation: Infinite

Games in Review & Featured Articles

It was a middling week for our reviews this week, unless you’re into a bit of musou.

  • Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment – NSW2 – 8/10
  • Football Manager 26 – PS5, XSX|S, PC, Mac – 6/10
  • Hotel Barcelona – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 6/10
  • Rise of Industry 2 – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 6/10
  • Painkiller – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 5/10
  • Biped 2 – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, PC – 4/10

Then we had reviews of the Boulies Master Series 2025 gaming chair, and the Turtle Beach Racer Wireless Wheel, which you can pop onto your lap for some race time.

Beyond that, Dom spoke to the cast behind the ambitious FMV revival of AKIBA Lost, and I got another hands on session with Kirby Air Riders ahead of this weekend’s multiplayer test

Rounding out the week, What We Played featured Arc Raiders, Ghost of Yotei and Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment.

Trailer Park

Metroid Prime 4: Beyond has got a new trailer

Kiborg dev announces party game Chicken Chicken

The PEAK ROOTS update is here

Your Achievements

What have you been playing this week?

  • TSBonyman told us tales of Conquistadorio and Thimbleweed Park, the former having more of a Machinarium tone, and the latter being akin to a classic LucasArts point and clicker.

That’s the round up for this week’s round up. Enjoy the weekend, and we’ll catch you for more gaming shenanigans next week!



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/08/something-for-the-weekend-08-11-25/

item.title: The end of Halo Infinite content is here with Operation: Infinite
item.content:encoded:
Halo Studios has announced that Halo Infinite has reached the end of the road as a live service, with Operation: Infinite set to be the last major content update when it arrives on 18th November.

The team writes, “As we look back on four years of evolution and updates in Halo Infinite, we’d like to thank our community for your steadfast support. Without your feedback and enthusiasm, Halo Infinite multiplayer would not be the special place it is today: a robust arena for slaying and playing, with something for every Spartan.

“With multiple Halo titles in development, we’ll need our whole team’s combined focus to deliver new experiences with the same passion and care that our community has given us. While we remain committed to supporting Halo Infinite on the road ahead, Operation: Infinite is the last major content update currently planned.”

This final content update will bring a 2X boosts to Career Rank and SP, a 100-tier Operation Pass, eight armour sets to earn, new Ranked Seasons, and 200 new customisations in The Exchange.

Following this, the game will still be receiving stability updates, and Halo Studios will continue to support it with rotating in-game challenges to let you progress through the Operation Passes that will remain available, and there will be new ranked rewards, ranked seasons and community events. There just won’t be any more big content drops and battle passes.

This is in large part down to Halo Studios needing to put more resources toward their upcoming projects. A lot is being made of the studio’s old plan for Halo Infinite to be a 10-year game, but that plan was made at a very different time with different studio leadership, and grand aspirations for the Xbox Series X|S generation. But Halo Infinite then suffered a difficult launch, the Xbox Series has struggled, and Microsoft has dramatically changed its plans. For Halo, the studio has jumped across to developing in Unreal Engine 5, it’s rebranded from 343 Industries to Halo Studios, and Halo: Campaign Evolved has been announced – a remake of the first game in UE5 that’s coming to PS5, Xbox Series and PC. There’s also another mooted live service game rumoured to be in the works.

I enjoyed Halo Infinite through its first year or so, but it’s actually a little bit surprising that the studio stuck it out this long.

Source: Halo Waypoint



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/08/the-end-of-halo-infinite-content-is-here-with-operation-infinite/

item.title: Whiskerwood patch 2 lowers taxes and fixes more issues
item.content:encoded:
Hot on the heels of the first Whiskerwood patch, developer Minakata Dynamics has released patch number 2 for Whiskerwood. This patch lowers taxes on normal difficulty, allows players to add more logs to fires to make them last longer, and stops snowstorms forming when the temperature is high. There are also some other changes and fixes which you can see in the list below.

Features

  • Players can now manually extra logs to campfires thus keeping the fire alive
  • Add button to reset graphic settings to default in case player enter invalid screen configuration

Gameplay

  • Nerf whisker population tax from 5 to 3 per whisker per day in normal difficulty
  • Nerf pollution generated by all heaters by half
  • Reduce production tax by 33% across all difficulties
  • Improve mine tool behavior when mining floors
  • Make stone paths related quest require a schematic check and randomize start day
  • Make 89 whisker population quest from Claws trigger randomly and after second year
  • Increased the priority of harvesting crops
  • Increased the recovery speed of soil nutrients
  • Cold temperatures no longer slow and stop nutrient recovery
  • Increased the yield of unfertilized crops. Fertilizer boost is reduced to 150%, but due to the overall increase, fertilized crops yield the same as before 
  • Fully grown crops no longer drain nutrients
  • Farmers now always fertilize crops when sowing if fertilizer is stocked and enabled

UI

  • Fix tutorial dialogs windows not wrapping long text lines

Bugs

  • Fix snowstorms occurring at high temperatures.
  • Fix schools wrongly displaying a “no workers” warning after using pause toggle
  • Improved colors of wheat
  • Fix Fire Tender & Luxury Supplier not being listed in the workplace overview
  • Fire vfx may be become detached from the Campfire
  • Fix Terrain for mining underground cannot be marked when it sticks to the wall without using the Slice View
  • Fix dock decking missing shadows
  • Reduce height of dock roof, fixing clipping issue.
  • Fix camps not remembering allowed resources when loading save.
  • Fix sunlight blockage by buildings not being loaded correctly from save files.
  • Fix wheat not displaying fertility colors in fertility view mode

Acknowledgements

  • Thank you to RonEmpire for reporting the charter sign cutscene still forces a camera movement even when the dock camera move setting is disabled
  • Thank you to Seagullible for reporting the oddly early triggering of certain quests and how they felt like the game being unreasonable and not the Claws being unreasonable
  • Thank you to shivvr for reporting the incorrect “no workers” warning for schools on Discord.
  • Thank you to Kroneus for drawing attention to the color of young wheat. 
  • Thank you to Falk for reporting that Fire Tenders were missing in the workplace overview.
  • Thank you to HH on discord for reporting the missing shadows on the dock building
  • Thank you to ladykayura, Raia-Jicin, AUSGrizzly for feedback on farming
  • Thank you Aintaer for reporting that buildings weren’t correctly blocking light.

Source: Steam

Related stories from TSA



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/08/whiskerwood-patch-2-lowers-taxes-and-fixes-more-issues/

item.title: Escape From Duckov hits 3 million sales
item.content:encoded:
Escape From Duckov has hit 3 million sales since it launched on October 16th, Team Soda has announced. It is one of the big indie success stories of the year, with players taking to the slightly bizarre premise of the game. In Escape From Duckov, players play as an armed duck in a survival RPG where the goal is to gather resources, build a base, and survive the more hostile ducks that live in the world.

In a message celebrating 3 million sales, Team Soda said, “Three million Ducklings have gathered! Whether you’re a newcomer just joining Duckov, a seasoned duck with a warehouse full of treasures, a creative duck who loves to share Duckov with others, or a MOD duck making Duckov shine with your imagination and codes. Thank you to every Duckling! Because of you, Duckov stays full of life! The journey of Duckov is far from over. We’ll keep bringing you new content and an even better experience. Quack quack!”

A couple of days ago, Team Soda released Escape From Duckov update 1.1.6 released. If you need a refresher of what those notes are, click on the link or look at the list below.

Updates

  • Increased base range for all Sniper Rifles and the M107 by 2m.
  • Talent: Berserker now reduces Running Sound Range by 10% and Walking Sound Range by 10%.
  • Increased stack limit for 111 items (including all ammunition types, all fish, etc.).
  • Increased the strength of the School Bully and ??? against other AI enemies (no change to their difficulty against players).
  • 2x Scope: reduced ADS Time penalty from 0.12s to 0.1s.
  • 4x Scope: reduced ADS Time penalty from 0.5s to 0.3s. Increased Firearm Range by 5% and maximum Hip Fire Spread by 15%.
  • 8x Scope: reduced ADS Time penalty from 1s to 0.6s. Increased Firearm Range by 10% and maximum Hip Fire Spread by 25%.
  • Attachment: Laser (Rapid Response) now additionally provides +15% Firearm Range, +20% maximum Hip Fire Spread, and -13% maximum ADS Spread.
  • Increased inventory stack limits for Canned Gunpowder (Blue, Green, Red) from 8/8/4 to 10/10/8.
  • Significantly reduced character inertia.
  • Slightly increased the close-range hit detection area for melee attacks.
  • All firearms using Sniper Bullet can now penetrate one enemy. Firearms using Magnum Bullet can now penetrate two enemies.
  • Increased the minimum number of items found in Safe from 1 to 2.
  • Safe now have a chance to contain “Collectible” type items.
  • Optimized collision in several problematic areas of the map.
  • Added a Restore Default button to the key binding menu.
  • Increased the speed at which the field of view expands or contracts when Perception stats change.
  • Items now display source information on how they can be acquired.
  • Soda Crisis can now switch color modes.
  • Locker interface is now tabbed for easier navigation.
  • Greatly improved the aimed accuracy of the Repeating Bow.
  • Reduced the Reload Time for the Shoddy Bow.
  • The Mysterious Merchant in Farm Town now sells Key Case.
  • The Mysterious Merchant in Ground Zero now sells Ink.
  • Added several new items.
  • Added new character creation components.
  • Added a new melee weapon: Great Swordfish. Unlock it by completing King of Fishing quest. (If you’ve already completed the quest, claim the reward from the completed quests menu to purchase it).

MOD Related Updates

  • LevelManager.forceBossSpawn=true forces the boss to spawn.
  • LevelManager.enemySpawnCountFactor=2 doubles enemy spawn count (value is adjustable).
  • Modders can now disable the roof hiding feature by setting the static variable OcclusionFadeManager.FadeEnabled=false.
  • ItemAssetsCollection.GetPrefab(int typeID) will now prioritize returning a dynamic entry.
  • ItemAssetsCollection.TryGetDynamicEntry(…) is now public.
  • Added the InteractablePickup.OnPickupSuccess event, which triggers when an item is picked up.

Fixes

  • Fixed an issue where the Blueprint: Military Bagpack MAX would not display correctly in the Recipe Collection.
  • Fixed Storm Creature so they correctly deal Space Damage, and Space Damage reduction now works properly against them.
  • Fixed a bug where unload ammo from the Tote Bag would cause the ammo to disappear.
  • Fixed a description error with the Hardening Injector.
  • Fixed TOZ-66 Dragon’s Breath so it correctly ignites targets.
  • Fixed an issue where pressing ‘P’ in the backpack interface would disable the occlusion hiding feature.

Source: Steam



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/08/escape-from-duckov-hits-3-million-sales/
